intro: Senecio eupapposus, commonly known as the silverleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial with silver-gray foliage that reflects sunlight, helping it to retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
